summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from January 2020 discussing preparation for an interview with an Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) about human trafficking cases. The email highlights the FBI's Human Trafficking program and mentions high-profile cases like Epstein and NXIVM as examples, alongside other recent investigations.

persons.name: Hubert Dupigny
persons.role: Convicted individual in a sex trafficking case
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject of a recent sex trafficking conviction case spun off from the 'Hard Knock HT' investigation, used as an example of the FBI's work.

events.title: Planned ADIC Interview on Human Trafficking
events.description: An Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) of the FBI New York Field Office is scheduled to give a long-form interview for a monthly podcast with a radio station, with the first topic being human trafficking.

keyFacts: The FBI's Human Trafficking program is preparing to highlight its work, including high-profile cases like Epstein and NXIVM, in a media interview.
The 'Hard Knock HT' investigation is described as a large trafficking case with dozens of targets and strong ties to gangs.
The Hubert Dupigny conviction is cited as a recent example of the FBI's sex trafficking enforcement efforts.
The email chain involves multiple FBI personnel from the New York Field Office discussing case examples for public affairs purposes.
The document indicates the FBI was actively managing public messaging about human trafficking investigations in early 2020.
